nodes.text: The Corrupter was a Victory II-class Star Destroyer in the Imperial Navy during the Galactic Civil War.

Prior to the Battle of Endor, the Corrupter was assigned by the Empire to hunt down pirates and smugglers in the Outer Rim. Following the cataclysmic defeat at Endor and the schism of the Imperial ranks, this ship was reassigned to the personal fleet of Imperial Intelligence Director Ysanne Isard.

Isard used the Corrupter to defend Thyferra and Xucphra bacta convoys following her flight from Coruscant. Captain Ait Convarion, the ship's commanding officer, found and destroyed a bacta-hauling freighter stolen by members of Rogue Squadron—many members of the squad were killed as a result.

After this incident, the Corrupter began terrorizing worlds that refused to pay Isard's largely inflated prices for bacta, especially those that received free bacta "liberated" by the Rogues. The Corrupter's first target in this campaign was to destroy a colony on Halanit. The ship's TIE/sa bombers conducted an orbital bombardment using thermal detonators and proton bombs to melt the glacier and open a hole in the colony's roof. TIE interceptors and stormtroopers then attacked the colony in order to kill its people.

The Corrupter would, however, meet her end at the Graveyard. With the aid of the Immobilizer 418 cruiser Aggregator, the Corrupter's captain thought that he had the Rogues in an inescapable trap—until the sudden appearance of the Valiant, which attacked the unshielded portion of the destroyer. After suffering a considerable amount of damage from the squadron and the Alderaanian war cruiser, a pair of proton torpedoes fired by Wedge Antilles struck the bridge, killing Captain Convarion. The leaderless capital ship was soon abandoned. The Rogues and smugglers were unable to salvage the Corrupter, and it was destroyed by the Graveyard's asteroids.
